choices.A: Map<Id,Leas> lmap = new Map<Id,Lead>([Select ID from Lead Limit 8]);

questions.question_text: Which statement results in an Apex compiler error?

discussion.content: A n D look correct

Selected Answer: D
It is missing new operator

I saw Leas in A and I didnt read the rest.
The error is thr whole question.
A map lead is not same as leas. B invalid identifier

Correct answer A,B and D
A. Map<Id,Leas> lmap = new Map<Id,Lead>([Select ID from Lead Limit 8]); Leas is not the same as Lead.
B. Invalid identifier 'ג€˜2018'
D. Invalid identifier 'ג€˜aג€™'

comments.content: D is not correct because of the missing "new" keyword. The wrong encoding string is not rly a thing here.

discussion.content: Answer is D. String section start with "{" and end with ")".
Both A and D will lead to compile error.
Answer A contains a type. Map<Id,Leas> lmap = new Map<Id,Lead>([Select ID from Lead Limit 8]); Leas is not the same as Lead. This should throw an error as well.

questions.question_text:
A developer needs to test an Invoicing system integration. After reviewing the number of transactions required for the test, the developer estimates that the test data will total about 2 GB of data storage. Production data is not required for the integration testing.
Which two environments meet the requirements for testing? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
BD
The answer is BD, I think

Selected Answer: BD
Because size matter's :)

questions.question_text:
A developer wants to store a description of a product that can be entered on separate lines by a user during product setup and later displayed on a Visualforce page for shoppers.
Which field type should the developer choose to ensure that the description will be searchable in the custom Apex SOQL queries that are written?

comments.content: As a standard salesforce limitation, we cannot filter on the salesforce Text Area Long field. It will give us an error stating ‘Field cannot be filtered on a query call’.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct
Tested it, text area works

The correct answer is A. Reference a test utility class in each test class.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.apexcode.meta/apexcode/apex_testing_utility_classes.htm

Selected Answer: A
A is the correct answer here.

Selected Answer: A
A. Reference a test utility class in each test class. Most Voted

Selected Answer: A
I tried this, trust me, A is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: A
The answer is A

Selected Answer: A
It's is correct as said Balrick

choices.C: Create a Test Setup method for each test class.
choices.B: Define variables for test records in each test class.
choices.D: Use the SeeAllData=true annotation in each test class.
choices.A: Reference a test utility class in each test class.

questions.question_text:
A developer wants multiple test classes to use the same set of test data.
How should the developer create the test data?

A developer wants to display all of the picklist entries for the Opportunity StageName field and all of the available record types for the Opportunity object on a
Visualforce page.
Which two actions should the developer perform to get the available picklist values and record types in the controller? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Correct answer is A and D.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.apexref.meta/apexref/apex_class_Schema_PicklistEntry.htm#apex_Schema_PicklistEntry_methods

Selected Answer: AD
True answer is A&D
How on earth could B be right?????

Selected Answer: AD
B is wrong, that doesn't return the list of the values of the picklist, nor the record type. IT cannot be true.

Selected Answer: AD
You need picklist values for the specific field
